metadata.description: Arborist Technicians are adventurous and curious individuals, whose deep appreciation for trees, love of physical activity, and visual way of working create the beautiful communities we all enjoy.

markdown:
Skip to main content

![forest of trees with mountainous background in bc](/sites/default/files/2023-01/Arborist_web.jpg)

As an Arborist Technician, you’re skilled in all aspects of tree care, including identifying plants and examining and diagnosing pests and diseases. 

You enjoy working in an outdoor setting, and have an approach that spurs you to interact with your surroundings. You use your knowledge to assess the health and structure of a tree, determine its needs and identify appropriate treatments. 

#### What You'll Learn

  * How to identify different types of plants and trees 
  * How to treat injured and diseased plants and trees 
  * How to fall, limb and buck trees 
  * How to prune and perform other work on trees from the ground 
  * How to chip brush, cut wood and clean up after tree care operations 



#### Key Job Skills

  * Active listening 
  * Plant and tree identification 
  * Plant and tree treatment 
  * Falling, limbing and bucking 
  * Pruning and other groundwork 



#### Technical Training

To get certified, you will need to sign up for technical training at an approved training provider in addition to on-the-job training. 

Visit [_Trades Training BC_](https://www.tradestrainingbc.ca/) and [EducationPlannerBC](https://educationplannerbc.ca/search) for a comprehensive list of what programs are available in your trade at public and non-public schools. 

Technical Training 8 weeks over 1 year 

Work-Based Training

1600 HOURS

General Skills

[Adventurous](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AAdventurous) [Athletic](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AAthletic) [Curious](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3ACurious)

## 

Program Information and Resources

Note: Arborist Technician must be taken before [Climbing Arborist](/climbing-arborist). 

#### [Program Profile Occupational Description Arborist Technicians prune and perform work on trees from the ground. They identify plants, select rigging gear, and have knowledge of how to fall, limb and buck trees, assist climbers, chip brush, cut wood and clean-up sites after tree care operations.  View Profile](/media/486/download)

#### [Program Outline Guidelines for delivery of technical training at SkilledTradesBC Recognized Training Providers View PDF](/media/485/download) #### [Record Book An easy-to-use tool to help you identify your trades training needs, track your progress, and move towards certification.  View PDF](/media/2613/download)

## 

Exam Information and Resources

Certificate of Qualification Exam

Updates:

  * None




Information:

  * [Exam Breakdown](/media/1175/download)

  * Code book required: **none**




## 

Challenge the Trade

If you have significant work experience in a trade but have never been certified in Canada, you may apply to challenge the certification. Learn more about [How to Challenge a Skilled Trade](/challenge-skilled-trade).

OR

If you sponsor apprentices but have never been certified in Canada, you may request to supervise and sign-off apprentices when they are ready to be certified. Please [contact customer service](/contact-us) for more information.

#### [Instructions How to Apply View](https://skilledtradesbc.ca/instructions-challenge-certification) #### [Online Application Sign up for the Portal to start your online application Start Application](https://portal.skilledtradesbc.ca/Account/Login/Register?registrationType=certified) #### [Employer Declaration Document of relevant work experience View PDF](/media/846/download) #### [Statutory Declaration Attestation for self-employment/work experience when employer cannot be contacted View PDF](/media/847/download)
